docs.lead_paragraph: Michelle Wie shot a 5-under 67 Saturday to lead the HSBC Women's Champions tournament by two strokes after the third round.

headline.print_headline: Michelle Wie Shoots 67, Takes 2-Shot Lead in Singapore
headline.main: Michelle Wie Shoots 67, Takes 2-Shot Lead in Singapore

docs.lead_paragraph: Iran successfully test-fired a sophisticated Russian-made air defense system, the official IRNA news agency reported on Saturday.

headline.print_headline: Iran Tests Sophisticated Russian-Made Air Defense System
headline.main: Iran Tests Sophisticated Russian-Made Air Defense System

docs.snippet: Iran successfully test-fired a sophisticated Russian-made air defense system, the official IRNA news agency reported on Saturday....

docs.lead_paragraph: Twelve people, including women and children, are being treated for possible exposure to chemical weapons agents in Mosul, where Islamic State is fighting off an offensive by U.S.-backed Iraqi forces, the United Nations said on Saturday.

headline.print_headline: Twelve Treated for Chemical Weapons Agents in Mosul Since March 1: U.N.
headline.main: Twelve Treated for Chemical Weapons Agents in Mosul Since March 1: U.N.

docs.snippet: Twelve people, including women and children, are being treated for possible exposure to chemical weapons agents in Mosul, where Islamic State is fighting off an offensive by U.S.-backed Iraqi forces, the United Nations said on Saturday....

docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations warned that the alleged use of chemical weapons in Mosul, if confirmed, would be a war crime and a serious violation of international humanitarian law, according to a statement released Saturday.

headline.print_headline: UN: If Confirmed, Chemical Attacks in Mosul a War Crime
headline.main: UN: If Confirmed, Chemical Attacks in Mosul a War Crime

docs.snippet: The United Nations warned that the alleged use of chemical weapons in Mosul, if confirmed, would be a war crime and a serious violation of international humanitarian law, according to a statement released Saturday....

docs.lead_paragraph: Attorney General Jeff Sessions has been on the job less than a month but has already made some civil rights groups nervous by indicating the Justice Department will likely soften its focus on protecting voter rights and monitoring troubled police departments.

headline.print_headline: NAACP Head: Sessions Pledges to Enforce Civil Rights Laws
headline.main: NAACP Head: Sessions Pledges to Enforce Civil Rights Laws

docs.snippet: Attorney General Jeff Sessions has been on the job less than a month but has already made some civil rights groups nervous by indicating the Justice Department will likely soften its focus on protecting voter rights and monitoring troubled police ...

docs.lead_paragraph: President Donald Trump is accusing former President Barack Obama of having Trump's telephones "wire tapped" during last year's election, but Trump isn't offering any evidence or saying what prompted the allegation.

headline.print_headline: Trump Alleges Obama Had Trump Phones Wiretapped During Race
headline.main: Trump Alleges Obama Had Trump Phones Wiretapped During Race

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump is accusing former President Barack Obama of having Trump's telephones "wire tapped" during last year's election, but Trump isn't offering any evidence or saying what prompted the allegation....

docs.lead_paragraph: The families of those onboard missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 launched efforts Saturday to raise at least $15 million to fund a private search as they marked the third anniversary of the plane's disappearance.

headline.print_headline: Families Aim to Raise $15 Million to Search for Flight 370
headline.main: Families Aim to Raise $15 Million to Search for Flight 370

docs.snippet: The families of those onboard missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 launched efforts Saturday to raise at least $15 million to fund a private search as they marked the third anniversary of the plane's disappearance....

docs.lead_paragraph: Some Democrats worry the appointment of a Jeff Sessions subordinate to oversee an investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 election won't be a clean enough break from the embattled attorney general.
